abstract: An inquiry examines whether JPMorgan Chase hired the children of Chinese officials to help win business. | Some public funds are moving to reduce their reliance on the Wall Street. | SAC Capital Advisors is preparing to become leaner. | The latest deal by Alibaba may raise some eyebrows.
snippet: An inquiry examines whether JPMorgan Chase hired the children of Chinese officials to help win business. | Some public funds are moving to reduce their reliance on the Wall Street. | SAC Capital Advisors is preparing to become leaner. | The latest...
lead_paragraph: Federal authorities have opened a bribery investigation into whether JPMorgan Chase hired the children of Chinese officials to help the bank win business, Jessica Silver-Greenberg, Ben Protess and David Barboza report in DealBook.

headline.main: JPMorgan Faces Bribery Inquiry Over China

abstract: The Federal Reserve said Monday that some banks did not pay enough attention to the risks that were particular to their assets and operations.
snippet: The Federal Reserve said Monday that some banks did not pay enough attention to the risks that were particular to their assets and operations.
lead_paragraph: Most large banks appear to have been sailing through the annual “health checkups” they have had to undergo since the financial crisis.

headline.main: Banks Are Falling Short in Planning for the Worst, Fed Says
headline.print_headline: Banks Coming Up Short in Planning for the Worst, Fed Says
